All menus associated start with ORZ PHARM GLUCOSE Some menus state IDDM or NIDDM - IDDM stands for Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus NIDDM stands for Non-Isulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus. A. Fortner, CAC

Contents.Text: May provide 50 strips one time for additional short-term
monitoring for any of the following situations:
Starting treatment with oral or intravenous corticosteroids
Acute or ongoing illness which is anticipated to affect glucose control
Initiation of therapy with and/or active adjustment of diabetes medications
Detection of hyperglycemia when fasting and/or
post-prandial blood glucose levels are not consistent with HbA1c
Significant changes in patients' diet and exercise

DM ORZ GMENU DIABETES MANAGEMENT (UPDATE 7/2023)
Term: Edited 7/21/23 - update to VA/DoD guidelines To me, it seems that without comorbidities and with comorbidities could be the same for the first three agents (metformin, SGLT-2, GLP-1).  This is an opportunity to simplify the menu without needing to separate by the presence of comorbidities.  After that TZD (avoid in CHF and bladder cancer), or DPP-4 (alternative to GLP-1).  Then SFU and insulin.  MTB- CACEDITED 06/28/2023 - Given update to VA/DoD guidelines, needed to shift SGLT2i up on the menu. Also shifted some 3rd line agents around due to cost/guideline recommendations. New order will be: 2nd line SGLT2i, 3rd line SFU, DPP4i, then TZD Wyatt Gold, Pharmacy Informatics Created 8/3/22 per LEAF request #173 for Type 2 Diabetes Management Menu from Shane Crook.  MTB-CAC

Contents.Text: -Women should discontinue at least 2 months before planned pregnancy
-Use high glycemic variability (A1C fluctuation or fasting blood glucose) as a
prognostic indicator for risk of hypoglycemia, morbidity, and mortality
-Select A1c Target Range based on risk-benefit ratio, patient characteristics/
for most patients, when it can be safely obtained)
-AVOID in CHF and active Bladder Cancer patients
--Prioritize other classes of agents first, especially >= 65 yo
Semaglutide, Dulaglutide, Liraglutide (Weight (-), A1c dec. (-0.5 to -1.0))
-Consider starting temporarily for new presentations of diabetes WITH GLUCOSE
TOXICITY (BGs>300, A1C>10, or polyuria/polydipsia/weight loss). Once glucose
toxicity resolves, simplify and switch to preferred non-insulin agents
-If significant variability or not achieving glycemic goals while on insulin
therapy, use real-time continuous glucose monitoring to decrease hyopglycemia
